discovered.name: Algolia
discovered.description: Algolia delivers a hosted, developer-first AI search platform (NeuralSearch) that combines vector, keyword, and semantic ranking to power in-app, site, and e-commerce discovery, offered via REST/GraphQL APIs and SDKs.
discovered.evidence: Algolia markets itself as a “Search-as-a-Service” platform for developers, offering a hosted search API, AI/ML-driven ranking (NeuralSearch, vector search, hybrid search), and relevance-tuning tools. Its documentation and pricing pages explicitly target software engineers and AI teams that need to embed search in their apps or sites. Algolia positions its “AI Search” and “Recommend” products as developer APIs and recently launched NeuralSearch for semantic, generative‐AI-enhanced search—placing it in the AI Search segment.

discovered.name: Consensus
discovered.description: Consensus.ai (Consensus.app) offers an AI-powered search engine that semantically queries academic papers and generates concise, evidence-based answers, helping researchers, students, and knowledge workers locate and digest scientific information faster.
discovered.evidence: Consensus.app is a venture-funded startup that uses large-language-model technology to search and synthesize findings from millions of peer-reviewed research papers. It markets itself as an “AI-powered search engine for scientific literature,” sells individual and team subscriptions to researchers and students, and positions its product as an AI research assistant that returns evidence-based answers extracted directly from source papers—functionality that overlaps Tavily’s “research assistant/AI search engine” use case. However, Consensus does not (today) emphasize a public Search API for developers, nor does it cover the full, real-time web; its go-to-market is primarily end-user SaaS, not developer tooling.

queries.query: AI-powered web search API startup alternatives
queries.context: Broad keyword combo surfaces startup directory and listicles that catalog niche AI search API providers directly comparable to Tavily.
